# DaemonEye

> Security-focused, privilege-separated process monitoring and detection system providing process collection, SQL-driven detection rules, and tamper-evident audit logging.

DaemonEye implements a three-component architecture (`procmond`, `daemoneye-agent`, `daemoneye-cli`) with strict privilege separation and a shared core library. Use this index to locate normative specifications, core conceptual docs, and operational guidance. Prefer Documentation first for orientation; Specifications define authoritative requirements and limits; Configuration covers install/deploy/hardening guidance.

## Documentation
- [AGENTS](AGENTS.md): AI assistant rules of engagement and precedence hierarchy
- [README](README.md): Project overview, goals, quick start
- [SECURITY](SECURITY.md): Security policy, reporting process, vulnerability disclosure
- [WARP](.kiro/steering/development.md): Operational commands and development workflows
- [docs/src/architecture](docs/src/architecture.md): Architecture index linking to detailed subsystem docs
- [docs/src/contributing](docs/src/contributing.md): Contribution guidelines and processes
- [docs/src/getting-started](docs/src/getting-started.md): Initial setup and quick start workflow
- [docs/src/introduction](docs/src/introduction.md): High-level product introduction and context
- [docs/src/pricing](docs/src/pricing.md): Pricing model and tier summary
- [docs/src/project-overview](docs/src/project-overview.md): Component overview and value proposition
- [docs/src/security](docs/src/security.md): Security model, threat considerations, controls summary
- [docs/src/testing](docs/src/testing.md): Testing strategy, tiers, tooling, quality gates

## Specifications
- [spec/adr-ipc-interprocess](spec/adr-ipc-interprocess.md): ADR for migrating IPC transport to interprocess crate
- [spec/daemon_eye_spec_sql_to_ipc_detection_architecture](spec/daemon_eye_spec_sql_to_ipc_detection_architecture.md): SQL-to-IPC detection architecture specification
- [spec/product](spec/product.md): Product feature specifications and tier definitions
- [spec/structure](spec/structure.md): Workspace/component structure and architectural boundaries
- [spec/tech](spec/tech.md): Technology stack decisions and enforced requirements
- [docs/src/api-reference](docs/src/api-reference.md): API reference index
- [docs/src/architecture/feature-tiers](docs/src/architecture/feature-tiers.md): Feature differentiation across Free/Business/Enterprise tiers
- [docs/src/architecture/system-architecture](docs/src/architecture/system-architecture.md): Core system architecture and data flows
- [docs/src/technical](docs/src/technical.md): Technical topics index for deeper implementation areas
- [docs/src/technical/business-tier](docs/src/technical/business-tier.md): Business tier technical extensions
- [docs/src/technical/core-monitoring](docs/src/technical/core-monitoring.md): Core monitoring capabilities requirements context
- [docs/src/technical/enterprise-tier](docs/src/technical/enterprise-tier.md): Enterprise tier advanced capabilities
- [docs/src/technical/ipc-implementation](docs/src/technical/ipc-implementation.md): IPC implementation details and patterns

- [docs/src/technical/security_design_overview](docs/src/technical/security_design_overview.md): Security design overview and threat model
- [docs/src/technical/sql-dialect-reference](docs/src/technical/sql-dialect-reference.md): SQL dialect reference and supported features
